item.title: Pair Blogging: The Epoch
item.description: AD: So how do we write a blog post together Vito? VC: What do you want to write about? AD: I donâ€™t know What should we? Tech? Culture? Life? Letâ€™s do it bro VC: Sure UX maybe ðŸ˜Š inclusive UX? AD: That isnâ€™t bad Something we have strong opinions about Or maybe contrasting opinions Hah! VC: but I tend to eventually agree with yours though ðŸ˜Š AD: Other way round lol!

item.title: To queue or not to queue
item.description: Itâ€™s kind of a tacit art more than science. It also depends on the motivations of the architect and the team. Ceteris paribus (i.e. we do not consider application design here), Iâ€™ll say thereâ€™s the ideal, and thereâ€™s the pragmatic. Ideally, the queue-based load leveling pattern calls for a high throughput queue to be placed before services (such as that for data persistency) as it may be slower (memory vs disk, etc.
